text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^2 \rightarrow \mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] be the transformation that rotates vectors by [mathjaxinline]90^\circ[/mathjaxinline] counterclockwise.

font.p: Since [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is a rotation, the image of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is all of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline], which has dimension 2. Thus, the rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is 2. The only vector that is sent to [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline] by a rotation is [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline] itself. Thus, the kernel of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is 0-dimensional.
